Author: Melissa Reynolds Davis
Content:
-Mona Marchand Peeples I used to experience the same thing. Then I heard that it helps to strain it really well. So I started straining it twice, once when it comes out of the juicer and then a second time with a finer meshed strainer as I pour it into my glass. It made all the difference for me. Now I can drink as much as I want and it doesn't hurt my stomach at all. 
You can also help your stomach by doing the medical medium aloe vera shock therapy. I was really having stomach issues until I did the Medical medium aloe vera shock therapy for 3 and 1/2 months straight. I still can't always eat spicy stuff now, but everything else is so much better.

Author: Melissa Reynolds Davis
Content: --Mona Marchand Peeples It's in the book Brain Saver by Anthony William. Or you can just Google medical medium aloe vera shock therapy and click on the medicalmedium.com website option. It explains how to do it correctly. Just make sure you don't eat any of the green outside part. It can irritate the stomach. I found it very helpful.

Author: Toni Marie
Content: After washing celery do we need to dry it before juicing it??

Author: Melissa Reynolds Davis
Content: -Toni Marie I've always wondered this. I've been drying it because he's always saying it shouldn't be diluted. But does that small amount of water really make a difference?

Author: Julie Adams
Content: -My vote is that it makes no difference.  A drop or two of water on the stalk is not the same as adding drinkable fluids.  I juiced for about 2 years daily and never dried the celery.  It worked, according to my bathroom schedule.
